label: Petition from Robert Sutherland to the St. Andrew's Society
description: Petition of Robert Sutherland to the St. Andrew's Society requesting assistance, explaining that he was intially thrust into poverty during King George's War in 1745 and is now entirely unable to support himself because of prolonged illness.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Petition of Robert Sutherland to the St. Andrew's Society requesting assistance, explaining that he was intially thrust into poverty during King George's War in 1745 and is now entirely unable to support himself because of prolonged illness.

metadata.label: Digitization Specifications
metadata.value: 300 dpi, 24-bit depth, color. Epson Expression 10000XL. Archival masters are tiffs.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
Ch. Town 2 Decr. 1771

To the worthy Members of the St. Andrews Society

Robert Sutherland begs have to represent

That he was born in Scotland and lived there reputably for many years. He was bred up to the [Service?] of that precarious element the sea in which way of life he acquired some money - working to improve it he [illegible] all the fruits of his former Labours in one bottom which he [illegible], but the whole war taken by the French around 1745 [illegible], by which means he became again reduced to poverty -- [illegible] however of the means of gaining a livelihood he embarked as Marker of a [illegible] in that [illegible] 'till [defeat?] at [Cart?] prevented him from doing the [illegible] office for himself or family. For the Phase of long three years was he confined to his bed or chamber and at last [illegible] by the [illegible] to Seek a more Southerly Climate for his recovery with not a penny in his pocket --

In My [illegible] he [illegible] have to apply [illegible] on his worthy Countrymen hoping that by great well intended benevolence he may be [illegible] in once more endeavoring to procure himself a subsistence in this [distant?] clime without burdening the publick - His [illegible] being [illegible] him applying when for [illegible] the prayers which he now [illegible] offers up for your [illegible]

Robt. Sutherland [signature of applicant]
